Event.0: 90s pop sensation singer Peter Andre (36) divorces glamour model Katie Price (31) due to unreasonable behaviour after 3 years of marriage
Event.1: German filmmaker Leni Riefenstahl—who was perhaps the finest and most-influential female director of the 20th century, but her association with Adolf Hitler made her almost as much reviled as admired—died in Germany.
Event.2: Kylie Minogue releases her single "I Just Can't Get You Out of My Head", the biggest of her career
Event.3: Mark McGwire of the St. Louis Cardinals broke Roger Maris's 1961 record for most home runs in a regular professional baseball season by hitting his 62nd of the season (he finished the season with 70 home runs).
Event.4: "The Oprah Winfrey Show" is first broadcast nationally
Event.5: Richard M. Nixon, who had resigned the U.S. presidency on August 8, 1974, was pardoned by his successor, Gerald Ford.
Event.6: Black September hijackings begin, three airliners hijacked and blown up by Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine
Event.7: The first episode of the sci-fi series Star Trek aired on American television.
Event.8: Nationwide release (US) of Alfred Hitchcock's "Psycho" starring Anthony Perkins and Janet Leigh
Event.9:
Ruby Bridges
American civil rights activist
was born
Event.10: At the end of World War II, the first U.S. troops entered the Korean peninsula south of the 38th parallel to receive the Japanese surrender; north of the parallel, Japanese troops surrendered to Soviet forces.
Event.11:
Bernie Sanders
United States senator
was born
Event.12: German and Finnish armies began a siege of Leningrad (now St. Petersburg), Russia, which lasted for 872 days.
Event.13:
Patsy Cline
American singer
was born
Event.14:
Peter Sellers
British actor
was born
Event.15: British actor Peter Sellers, who portrayed an astonishing range of characters but was perhaps best known as inept Inspector Jacques Clouseau in the Pink Panther films, was born.
Event.16: Babe Ruth hits his 26th HR off Jack Quinn in NY, breaking Buck Freeman's 1899 HR mark of 25
Event.17: Confederate General James Longstreet (76) weds Helen Dortch (34) at the governor's mansion in Atlanta, Georgia
Event.18: Business magnate John D. Rockefeller (25) weds abolitionist Laura Spelman (24)
Event.19:
Antonín Dvořák
Bohemian composer
was born
Event.20: American troops commanded by General Nathanael Greene defeated British forces under Lieutenant Colonel Alexander Stewart in the Battle of Eutaw Springs during the American Revolution.
Event.21: Marriage of George III of the United Kingdom to Charlotte of Mecklenburg-Strelitz (Queen Charlotte).
Event.22: Dutch surrender colony of New Netherlands (including New York) to 300 English soldiers
Event.23: As part of the Anglo-Dutch Wars, the duke of York (later James II) took the city of New Amsterdam, whose name was changed to New York.
Event.24: 1st permanent European settlement in the US founded at St. Augustine, Florida
Event.25: Spanish navigator Juan de Elcano returns to Spain, completing 1st circumnavigation of the globe (expedition began under Ferdinand Magellan)
Event.26: Michelangelo's statue of David is unveiled in Florence
Event.27:
Paris attacked by Joan of Arc
On this day in 1429, French heroine Joan of Arc, a peasant girl who believed she was acting under divine guidance, attempted to oust the duke of Burgundy and take Paris for newly crowned King Charles VII.
Event.28: Battle on Kulikovo: Moscow's great monarch Dimitri beats Mongols beginning the decline of the Tatars
